author: Ashish Tripathi
title: Amitabh Thakur vs Mulayam case: Court Commission appointed for Nutan’s locker search
text:
LUCKNOW: Special Judge PC Act Lucknow Anand Prakash-II on Friday appointed a Court Commission for search of PNB Gomtinagar bank locker of activist Nutan Thakur, wife of IPS officer Amitabh Thakur who is facing wrath of the state government after he lodged complaint against Samajwadi Party chief Mulayam Sngh Yadav.
The court passed the order after Thakur couple informed court that Vigilance officers may play 'dirty tricks' during the search process to frame-up their family. Appointing advocates Vijay Kumar Yadav and Mahendra Pratap Tiwari as Court Commissioners, the court directed police investigating officer Daddan Chaube to search the locker in presence of the two along with the Thakurs. It directed video-recording of the proceedings and to submit report by October 20.
READ ALSO: IPS officer Amitabh Thakur gives CD of Mulayam threat call to police
The court also sought report on search warrant taken by the investigating officer for the locker (No BB 00103) already surrendered by Nutan in September 2014. The Court directed the Vigilance officer to provide a copy of the search list to Thakurs. Amitabh had alleged that the Vigilance officers did not provide him the list as per the law. Vigilance officials had searched Thakur's house on October 13 in connection with disproportionate case against him.
About other complaints of irregularities in the search, the court directed that detailed order shall be passed after hearing both the parties.
Amitabh was suspended soon after he lodged complaint against Mulayam of threatening him on phone. The state government then also ordered Vigilance Establishment to probe complaints of disproportionate assets against Amitabh. The probe was conducted within two months and FIR under the Prevention of Corruption Act was lodged against Amitabh. The alleged threat call came after Nutan lodged a case against a minister on charges of corruption. Investigations in threat call case are underway.
READ ALSO: UP vigilance raids house of Amitabh Thakur in disproportionate assets case
Amitabh has also lodged a complaint with the police and chief judicial magistrate (CJM) accusing Vigilance officers of creating a false document to frame him in disproportionate asserts case. The police has given clean chit to Vigilance officer. However, the CJM will hear the case on October 19. Amitabh approached CJM after police initially refused to lodge an FIR on his complaint.
